ygData.subject: Re: Soloing in Kaladim
ygData.msgSnippet: Your friend should never have tried Unrest at lvl 10.  From lvl 12 on is a good time to start.  As I mentioned in an earlier post, only myself and a cleric
ygData.messageBody:
Your friend should never have tried Unrest at lvl 10. From lvl 12 on is a
good time to start. As I mentioned in an earlier post, only myself and a
cleric friend went there at lvl 12 and gained 4 lvls in 2 days. Just stay
in the courtyard and kill Death Beetles, Tormented Dead, Greater Skeletons,
Jack o Laterns, and the occasional Ghoul, if your friend has any magical
attacks. Also, don't be afraid when you con the Death Beetles and they turn
out to be blue, that you waited too long. For some reason, the Death
Beetles give out excellent xp and I was still gaining decent xp off of them
at lvl 16.

On another note, Unrest is a great place to revist once you hit 20th or so.
The house has mobs anywhere from 18th lvl up to 36th lvl. Again, great xp
and awesome loot, they drop fine steel weapons, bloodstained armor, and
bronze plate mail. So for any of you that have reached the higher lvls and
are looking for a place to hunt, Unrest is better than most ;)

Talarin, High Elven Wizard

----- Original Message -----
From: Ken Lee <kenlee@...>
To: <eq_wizards@onelist.com>
Sent: Wednesday, April 21, 1999 10:06 AM
Subject: [eq_wizards] Soloing in Kaladim


> From: "Ken Lee" <kenlee@...>
>
> Well, on someone's advice, forget whom it was, but I made the trip to
> Kaladim to plumb the depths of Unrest. I'm 14th level and just coming into
> my power right now. Right now the rest of the people in my group are
between
> 3-5 levels below me. So I figure I'll just solo and get xps slower, but
also
> not hinder their progress either. Where should I go? I've gone to the
> chessboard and killed pawns, bishops and their annoying pets, as well as
the
> odd King that shows up. A dwarven friend of mine was telling me how his 6
> member lvl 10 party was completely wiped out in Unrest down to the last
man.
> I made the following conclusions:
>
> a. Unrest is nasty
> b. My dwarven friend's party is stupid for not running from something they
> can't win
>
> I can admire going out gloriously next to your comrade, but not when death
> isn't permanent.
>
> So, question, if I take my group into unrest what should I be looking to
> kill? Is there somwhere else that is nearby that I should go instead? My
> dwarf friend said to hit the steamfonts, suggestions?
>
> Zalbar
> 14th Wizard
> Solusek Ro
>
>
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
